{{Primary sources|date=August 2009}} {{Infobox Airline | airline = Aero Slovakia | logo = Aeroslovakia.gif | logo_size = | fleet_size = 34 | destinations = | IATA = - | ICAO = ASO | callsign = AERO NITRA | parent = | company_slogan = | founded = 1992 | headquarters = [[Nitra Airport]]
[[Nitra]], [[Slovakia]] | key_people = | hubs = | secondary_hubs = | focus_cities = | frequent_flyer = | lounge = | alliance = | website = http://www.aeroslovakia.sk/ }} '''Aero Slovakia''' is an aviation company based in [[Slovakia]] offering a range of aviation services, including agriculture & forestry, patrolling & monitoring, [[Aerial photography|photography]] and [[air taxi]] operations.{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=20783696|title=Aero Slovakia information-Bloomberg|accessdate=15 July 2018}} The company has its head office on the grounds of [[Nitra Airport]], [[Nitra]]."[http://www.aeroslovakia.sk/en/ About] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100102052304/http://www.aeroslovakia.sk/en/ |date=2010-01-02 }}." Aero Slovakia. Retrieved on 3 March 2010. The airline employs 20 staff, under the command of Lubomir Kovacik. ==Fleet== The airline's fleet comprises 34 aircraft, including: *[[Antonov An-2]] *[[Cessna 150]] *[[Cessna 152]] *[[Cessna 172]] *[[Zlín Z 37|Zlín Z37A]] "Čmelák" *[[Zlín Z 37|Zlín Z137 Turbo]] *[[Zlín Z 42|Zlín Z42]] *[[Zlín Z 43|Zlín Z43]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20090823014652/http://www.aeroslovakia.sk/en/ Aero Slovakia] *[http://www.aeroslovakia.sk/ Aero Slovakia] {{sk icon}} {{Airlines of Slovakia}} [[Category:Airlines of Slovakia]] [[Category:Slovak brands]] {{Europe-airline-stub}} {{Slovakia-transport-stub}}

page.title: Austria in the Eurovision Young Musicians

revision.text:
{{Infobox song contest country |Name = Austria |Flag = Flag of Austria.svg |Member station = [[ORF (broadcaster)|ORF]] |National selection event = |ESC apps = 18 (14 finals) |ESC first = [[Eurovision Young Musicians 1982|1982]] |ESC last = [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2016|2016]] |ESC best = 1st: [[Eurovision Young Musicians 1988|1988]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 1998|1998]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2002|2002]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2004|2004]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2014|2014]] |ESC worst = Failed to qualify: [[Eurovision Young Musicians 1986|1986]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 1994|1994]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2008|2008]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2010|2010]] |Website = |EBU page = http://www.youngmusicians.tv/country/austria }} '''Austria''' has participated in the '''[[Eurovision Young Musicians]]''' 18 times since its debut in [[Eurovision Young Musicians 1982|1982]] and is the most successful country in the contest, with a total of five wins. Austria has hosted the contest a record six times, in [[Eurovision Young Musicians 1990|1990]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 1998|1998]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2006|2006]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2008|2008]], [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2010|2010]] and [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2012|2012]].{{cite web|title=Country profile: Austria|url=http://www.youngmusicians.tv/page/history/by-country/country?country=10|website=youngmusicians.tv|publisher=European Broadcasting Union|accessdate=16 October 2014}} On 29 October 2015, the Austrian broadcaster [[ORF (broadcaster)|Österreichischer Rundfunk]] (ORF) informed Eurovoix.com that they would withdraw from the event in 2016. Austria last participated at the [[Eurovision Young Musicians 2014|2014]] Young Musicians, which they won.{{cite web|url=http://eurovoix.com/2015/10/29/austria-withdraws-from-eurovision-young-musicians/|title=Austria: Withdraws From Eurovision Young Musicians|website=Eurovoix.com|date=29 October 2015|accessdate=29 October 2015}} However, later on 11 January 2016 it was announced that Austria would compete in the 2016 contest.{{cite web|last1=Granger|first1=Anthony|title=Austria: Eurovision Young Musicians 2016 Participation Confirmed|url=http://eurovoix.com/2016/01/11/austria-eurovision-young-musicians-2016-participation-confirmed/|website=Eurovoix.com|accessdate=11 January 2016}} ORF decided to withdraw from the 2018 edition, after participating at every previous edition of the contest, with no reasons for their withdrawal being published.{{cite web|last1=Farren|first1=Neil|url=https://eurovoix.com/2018/02/02/eurovision-young-musicians-2018-18-countries-take-part/|title=Eurovision Young Musicians 2018: 18 Countries to Take Part|website=eurovoix.com|date=2 February 2018|accessdate=2 February 2018}} == Contestants == ;Table key {{legend|gold|Winner}} {{legend|silver|Second place}} {{legend|#cc9966|Third place}} {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! revision.text:
{{see also|T and O map}} {{Translation_WIP|Mapa Mundi de Beato de Liébana|Spanish|es|English|en}}
[[File:ApocalypseStSeverFolios45v46rWorldMap.jpg|thumb|300px|The image shows a copy of the ''Beatus Map'' from the [[Saint-Sever Beatus]], produced in [[Saint-Sever Abbey]], France. The map is faced eastwards, and not northwards, as usual in modern cartography. For this reason it is said that the map is ''oriented''.<ref>The manuscript was executed ca. 1050 under the orders of the abbot, Gregori de Montaner</ref>]]
The '''Beatus Map''' or '''Beatine Map''' is one of the most significant cartographic works of the European Early Middle Ages: It was originally drawn by the Spanish monk [[Beatus of Liébana]], based on the accounts given by [[Saint Isidore of Seville]], [[Ptolemy]] and the [[Holy Bible]]. Although the original manuscript is lost, there remain several copies extant, which retain a high fidelity with respect the original.
The Map is shown in the prologue of the second book of Beatus' work ''[[Commentary on the Apocalypse]]''. Its main goal is not to depict a cartographically exact depiction of the world and its continents, but to illustrate the primitive Diaspora of the Apostles.
==The European world view in the High Middle Ages==
According to the descriptions of the [[Book of Genesis]] (which was one of the main sources of Beatus), the Earth was thought to be plane and to sustain the vault of heaven, where the Sun, the Moon, and many other minor [[luminary (astrology)|luminaries]] like planets and stars, moved. There were two sorts of water masses: The ''waters above'' the firmament, which were contained by the vault of heaven and occasionally fell to Earth in form of rain, when the floodgates opened, and the ''waters below'', which nurtured the rivers, the streams and the great salt water masses.
[[File:Hieronymus Bosch - The Garden of Earthly Delights - The exterior (shutters).jpg|thumb|250px|This image of [[The Garden of Earthly Delights]] illustrates the Hebrew ''[[world view|Weltanschauung]]'' which is reflected in the book of Genesis. The Earth is a disc surrounded by two water masses: the ''upper waters'', which occasionally fall to earth in form of rain when [[YHVH]] opens the floodgates of Heaven, and the ''lower waters'', formed by the seas, the lakes and the Ocean. In the depths of the Cosmic Sphere lay the ''[[sheol]]'', dwelling of the dead until the Judgement Day.]]In this ''mappamundi'', the world is represented as a circular disc surrounded by the Ocean. The Earth is divided in three continents: Asia (upper semicircle), Africa (right lower quadrant) and Europe (left lower quadrant), which belonged respectively to the descendants of the three sons of Noah: [[Shem]], [[Ham (son of Noah)|Ham]] and [[Japheth]]. The continental masses are separated by water streams and inner seas like the Mediterranean (Europe-Africa), the Nile River (Africa-Asia) and the [[Bosporus]] and the Aegeus Sea (Europe-Asia). In the center of the world lays Jerusalem, sacred city to Christianity and Judaism alike, where Abraham was about to sacrifice his own son, Isaac, and where the happenings of the Passion and Resurrection of Jesus did take place. The conception of [[Jerusalem]] as an ''ombilicum mundi'' was quite usual in the medieval Christian spirituality: In the [[Divine Comedy]], Dante starts his travel to hell from the soils of this city.
==The description of the continents==
===Asia===
[[File:Folio 25v - The Garden of Eden.jpg|thumb|left|250px|In this illustration from the calendar page of the book [[The Very Rich Hours of the Duke of Berry]] is shown the expulsion of Adam and Eva from the earthly Paradise. During all the Middle Ages it was believed that the Garden of Eden was located at the eastern end of the world, and that it was possible, in theory, to reach that place. Columbus attempted it.]]At the eastern end of Asia is found the [[Garden of Eden]], a paradisical territory where it is never cold or hot, and where trees and wood of all kinds grow. In its center stands the Tree of Life, and next to it there is a fountain from which the four rivers of Paradise: [[Tigris]], [[Euphrates]], [[Pishon]] and [[Gihon]] flow. The entrance to Paradise is protected by a Cherub who brandishes a sword of fire.
On the southern coast of the Asian continent is found [[India]], an enormous territory traversed by three rivers, the [[Indus]], [[Ganges]] and Hipane. It is abundant in men of dark color, elephants, rhinoceroses, spices and precious stones such as rubies, emeralds or diamonds. Its fields are blessed by the west wind, Favonio, and for that reason they yield two harvests a year. In that location are found the Mountains of Gold, access to which is forbidden to humans by griffins and dragons. Off the Indian coast are the islands of Taprobane (Sri Lanka, formerly Ceylon), abundant with gems and elephants, Chrysa and Argyre, rich in gold and silver respectively, and finally Tyle, whose trees never lose their leaves (it has been speculated that this is some island of Indonesia).
To the west of India one finds [[Parthia]], a region that extends between the rivers Indus and Tigris. It is divided into five different provinces: Aracusia; Parthia proper, called thus by the Parthians, brave soldiers from Scythia who founded an empire that dealt with Rome on an equal basis; Assyria, called thus by Asshur, the son of Shem, famous for its purple dyes and all types of perfumes and ointments, in it situated Níniveh, the capital of the old empire of the Assyrians, and where Jonas the prophet went to preach futilely; Medes (northwest [[Iran]]), which is divided in two parts, Greater Medes ([[Hamadan]], [[Kermanshahan]], [[Qazvin]], [[Tehran]] and [[Espahan]]) and Smaller Medes ([[Azarbaijan]]); and finally [[Persia]], birthplace of King Cyrus, the anointed one of God, and the region where magical science arose for the first time, introduced by Nebroth the giant, after the confusion of languages had emerged in [[Babylon|Babel]].
[[File:Ziggarat of Ur 001.jpg|thumb|300px| Judeo-Christian tradition makes '''Ur of Caldea''' the mother country of the patriarch [[Abraham]]. The early Spanish '''Albeldense and Rotense Chronicles''', when they recount the Islamic invasion of Spain, make a subtle ethnic distinction between the invaders: [[Berber people|Berbers]] (such as Tarik) are given the name of '''[[Moors]]''', while the [[Arabs]] (the ethnic group of Musa ibn Nusayr) are called '''[[Chaldea]]ns'''. And in those times it was considered that Chaldea and not Arabia was the original country of the Saracens.]][[Mesopotamia]] is the region located between the rivers [[Tigris]] and [[Euphrates]]. There we find the regions of Babylon and Chaldea. [[Babylon]] was the ancient conqueror of the kingdom of Judah and the place where the Jewish people were exiled. In that city the revelations of the prophet Ezekiel took place, which had so much influence on the creation of the Prophetic Chronicle. From [[Chaldea]] (South of Mesopotamia), the Asturian Chronicles supposed, came the hordes that invaded Spain and were defeated by Pelayo in Covadonga. Among the most important cities of this region can be mentioned Ur, the birthplace of the patriarch Abraham, as well as Erech (or Uruk), which was founded by Enoch.
To the south of the Euphrates river and sinus Persicum (Persian Gulf), Arabia was located, a desert region whose southern part (present-day Yemen) received the name of Arabia Felix, Happy Arabia. It was a rich, fertile land where precious stones, myrrh and incense abounded. In it lived the fabulous bird phoenix, which after dying surrounded by fire was reborn of its ashes. On the northeast border of Arabia, already in territories of the old Roman Empire, extended the province of Syria, whose limits were the Caucasus and Taurus Mountains to the north, the Euphrates to the east, the Mediterranean Sea and Egypt to the west, and Arabia to the south. Syria had three different provinces: Comagena, Phoenicia, and Palestine. The territory of Phoenicia extended from the Mediterranean Sea to Mount Lebanon and the sea of Tiberiades. In Phoenicia were found the famous cities of Sidon and Tyre. In the latter they preached so much that the prophet Elias was Jesus Christ. Further south was located Palestine, which was subdivided into four different provinces: Galilee, where they nailed Jesus of Nazareth, the sea of Tiberiades, where a good part of the apostles worked as fishermen, and Monte Tabor, the place where the Transfiguration occurred.
===Africa=== Africa is obviously from the Nile river with a lake as its source. The Maghreb is named "Libia" and Africa is surrounded by a sea coloured red.
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://expositions.bnf.fr/marine/grand/por_109.htm Le renouveau des connaissances géographiques], Bibliothèque nationale de France * [http://cartographic-images.net/Cartographic_Images/207_Beatus.html The Beatus Map]

pushpin_map_caption = Location of airport in Montana / United States | pushpin_label = '''BIL''' | pushpin_label_position = right | r1-number = 7/25 | r1-length-f = 5,501 | r1-length-m = 1,677 | r1-surface = Asphalt | r2-number = 10L/28R | r2-length-f = 10,518 | r2-length-m = 3,206 | r2-surface = Asphalt | r3-number = 10R/28L | r3-length-f = 3,801 | r3-length-m = 1,159 | r3-surface = Asphalt | stat-year = 2011,2014 | stat1-header = Aircraft operations (2014) | stat1-data = 81,371 | stat2-header = Based aircraft (2014) | stat2-data = 167 | stat3-header = Passengers (2011) | stat3-data = 899,302 | footnotes = Sources: [[Federal Aviation Administration|FAA]]<ref name="FAA">{{FAA-airport|ID=BIL|use=PU|own=PU|site=12265.*A}}. Federal Aviation Administration. effective April 5, 2012.</ref> and [[Montana DOT]]<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.mdt.mt.gov/publications/docs/datastats/boardings-2011.pdf | title = State of Montana: Airline Boardings – 2011 | publisher = [[Montana Department of Transportation]] | year = 2011}}</ref> }}
'''Billings Logan International Airport''' {{airport codes|BIL|KBIL|BIL}} is two miles northwest of downtown [[Billings, Montana|Billings]], in [[Yellowstone County, Montana|Yellowstone County]], Montana. It is the second largest airport in Montana, having been surpassed by [[Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport|Bozeman]] in both number of gates as well as annual enplanements in recent years,<ref name="bts">{{cite web|url=http://www.transtats.bts.gov/airports.asp?pn=1&Airport=BZN&Airport_Name=Bozeman,%20MT:%20Bozeman%20Yellowstone%20International&carrier=FACTS|publisher=transtats.bts.gov|title=RITA | BTS | Transtats|accessdate=December 4, 2016}}</ref> and is owned by the city of Billings.<ref name="FAA" /><ref name="ci.billings.mt.us">{{cite web|url=http://ci.billings.mt.us/index.aspx?NID=257|publisher=ci.billings.mt.us|title=Billings Airport, MT - Official Website | Official Website |accessdate=December 4, 2016}}</ref> The airport is on top of the [[Rimrocks|Rims]], a {{convert|500|ft|adj=on}} cliff overlooking the downtown core. BIL covers 2,300 acres (9.3 km<sup>2</sup>.) of land.<ref name="FAA" />
The [[National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems]] for 2011–2015 [[FAA airport categories|categorized]] it as a ''primary commercial service'' airport (more than 10,000 enplanements per year).<ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.faa.gov/airports/planning_capacity/npias/reports/media/2011/npias_2011_appA.pdf |title=2011–2015 NPIAS Report, Appendix A |format=PDF, 2.03 MB |work=National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems |publisher=Federal Aviation Administration |date=October 4, 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120927084535/http://www.faa.gov/airports/planning_capacity/npias/reports/media/2011/npias_2011_appA.pdf |archivedate=September 27, 2012 |df=mdy }} </ref> [[Federal Aviation Administration]] records say the airport had 387,368 passenger boardings (enplanements) in [[calendar year]] 2013,<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.faa.gov/airports/planning_capacity/passenger_allcargo_stats/passenger/media/preliminary-cy13-commercial-service-enplanements.pdf | title = Enplanements for CY 2013 | format = PDF, 1.0 MB | work = | publisher = Federal Aviation Administration | date = June 20, 2014 | deadurl = yes | archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140816105358/http://www.faa.gov/airports/planning_capacity/passenger_allcargo_stats/passenger/media/preliminary-cy13-commercial-service-enplanements.pdf | archivedate = August 16, 2014 | df = mdy-all }} </ref> 388,329 in 2010 and 397,073 in 2009.<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.faa.gov/airports/planning_capacity/passenger_allcargo_stats/passenger/media/cy10_all_enplanements.pdf | title = Enplanements for CY 2010 | format = PDF, 189 KB | work = CY 2010 Passenger Boarding and All-Cargo Data | publisher = Federal Aviation Administration | date = October 4, 2011 }} </ref>
Billings Logan International Airport has scheduled nonstop flights to several [[airline hub]]s such as Dallas/Fort Worth, Denver, Minneapolis/St. Paul, Portland, Salt Lake City and Seattle. Billings also serves as a small hub for [[Cape Air]],<ref name="Cape Air"/> a commuter airline which operates nonstop flights with [[Cessna 402]] prop aircraft to [[Glasgow, Montana|Glasgow]], [[Glendive, Montana|Glendive]], [[Havre, Montana|Havre]], [[Sidney, Montana|Sidney]] and [[Wolf Point, Montana|Wolf Point]] in Montana.
==History==
The first recorded flight in Billings was in 1912 by a local dentist named [[Dr. Frank Bell]]. The flight was in his home-made [[Curtiss]] 0-X-5.
The "First" flight was made on Memorial Day 1913, with much publicity, Dr. Bell took off from Billings flying to [[Park City, Montana|Park City]] and back, {{convert|40|mi|km}} round trip. This flight was captured by a local artist named J.K. Ralston in his painting entitled "First Flight," displayed in the airport lobby.
In 1927 The City of Billings approved $5,000 and {{convert|400|acre|ha|0}} on top of the Rims to build a runway. The {{convert|1820|ft|m|adj=on}} runway and small administrative building was built by horse-drawn equipment; the airport opened on May 29, 1928.
In 1933 [[Northwest Airlines]] introduced the first scheduled passenger air service. Northwest was serving Billings in 1935 as a stop on a route between Chicago and Seattle flown with [[Lockheed Model 10 Electra]] twin prop airliners.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, Oct. 10, 1935 Northwest Airlines system timetable</ref> During the 1950s and early 1960s, Northwest operated [[Douglas DC-3]], [[Douglas DC-4]], [[Douglas DC-6B]] and [[Douglas DC-7C]] propeller aircraft into Billings.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, Oct. 1, 1955 & May 22, 1960 Northwest Airlines system timetables</ref>
Inland Air Lines was serving the airport in 1939 as a stop on a route between Denver and Great Falls.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, July 7, 1939 Inland Air Lines system timetable</ref> [[Western Airlines]] then acquired Inland Air Lines and in 1944 was serving Billings with [[Douglas DC-3]] and [[Lockheed Model 18 Lodestar]] twin prop aircraft on the route between Denver and Great Falls.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, Nov. 3, 1944 Western Airlines system timetable</ref> Western operated [[Convair 240]] and [[Douglas DC-6B]] propeller aircraft into the airport during the 1950s and early 1960s.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, March 1, 1956 & Sept. 6, 1960 Western Airlines system timetables</ref>
The original [[Frontier Airlines (1950-1986)]] was serving Billings in 1950 with [[Douglas DC-3]] aircraft operated on routes to Denver and Salt Lake City.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, Nov. 1, 1950 Frontier Airlines system timetable</ref> By 1962, Frontier had introduced [[Convair 340]] aircraft on its flights into the airport and would later serve Billings with [[Boeing 737-200]] jets as well as with [[Convair 580]] and [[de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter]] turboprops.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, Oct. 28, 1962 Frontier Airlines system timetable</ref><ref>http://www.departedflights.com, April 15, 1975 Official Airline Guide (OAG), Billings flight schedules</ref>
Improvements over the years include runway lights in 1935 to the new {{convert|120|ft|m|adj=on}} air traffic control tower in 2005. Major terminal expansions were made in 1958, 1972, and 1992. In early 2006 the airport added electronic monitors giving info on arrivals and departures.
The name changed from the Billings Municipal Airport to Billings Logan Field in 1957, after Dick Logan, the airport manager, died. In 1971 the airport became Billings Logan International Airport.<ref name="flybillings">{{cite web|url=http://www.flybillings.com/Index.aspx?NID=655|publisher=flybillings.com|title=Airport History | Billings Airport, MT - Official Website |accessdate=December 4, 2016}}</ref>
By 1961, [[Northwest Airlines]] was operating [[Lockheed L-188 Electra]] propjet service into the airport on a routing of New York [[Idlewild Airport]] (IDL, now [[JFK Airport]]) - Detroit (DTW) - Milwaukee (MKE) - Minneapolis/St. Paul (MSP) - Bismarck, ND (BIS) - Billings (BIL) - Great Falls (GTF) - Spokane (GEG) - Yakima (YKM) - Seattle (SEA).<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, May 28, 1961 Northwest Airlines system timetable</ref>
The jet age arrived in Billings by 1966 when Northwest introduced [[Boeing 727-100]] "Fan Jet" flights in addition to its Electra turboprop service.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, March 1, 1966 Northwest Airlines system timetable</ref> In 1968, Northwest was operating nonstop 727 jet service from the airport to Chicago [[O'Hare International Airport]], Minneapolis/St. Paul, Great Falls and Spokane as well as direct, no change of plane 727 flights to New York [[LaGuardia Airport]], Newark, Washington, D.C. [[National Airport]], Detroit, Cleveland, Milwaukee, Seattle and Portland, OR.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, July 1, 1968 Northwest Airlines system timetable</ref>
[[Western Airlines]] was serving Billings in 1966 with [[Lockheed L-188 Electra]] turboprops with an example routing being Los Angeles (LAX) - San Diego (SAN) - Phoenix (PHX) - Denver (DEN) - Cheyenne (CYS) - Casper (CPR) - Sheridan (SHR) - Billings (BIL).<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, Aug. 1, 1966 Western Airlines system timetable</ref> Western was also operating direct Electra propjet service to Calgary (YYC) via a stop in Great Falls (GTF) during the late 1960s.<ref>http://www.timetableimages.com, Aug. 1, 1968 Western Airlines system timetable</ref> By the early 1970s, Western was operating all of its flights into the airport with [[Boeing 737-200]] jetliners.<ref>http://www.departedflights.com, Sept. 6, 1973 Western Airlines system timetable</ref> In 1979, Western was operating nonstop [[Boeing 727-200]] service to both Minneapolis/St. Paul and Seattle as well as flying nonstop [[Boeing 737-200]] service to Denver, Great Falls and Salt Lake City.<ref name="departedflights.com">http://www.departedflights.com, Nov. 15, 1979 Official Airline Guide (OAG), Billings flight schedules</ref>
For at least part of each year from the late 1970s to early 1980s, Billings was served by wide body [[McDonnell Douglas DC-10]] jetliners operated by [[Northwest Airlines]]. In 1979, Northwest was flying DC-10 service on a round trip routing of Newark [[Liberty International Airport]] (EWR) - Detroit (DTW) - Chicago [[O'Hare International Airport]] (ORD) - Billings (BIL) - Great Falls (GTF) - Spokane (GEG) - Seattle (SEA).<ref name="departedflights.com"/> By 1982, the airline was operating the DC-10 on a round trip routing of Minneapolis/St. Paul (MSP) - Billings - Great Falls - Spokane - Seattle.<ref>http://www.departedflights.com, Aug. 1, 1982 Northwest Airlines system timetable</ref> The DC-10 was the largest aircraft ever to be operated in scheduled passenger service into the airport. For a short period in 1979, Northwest used a B-747 to provide passenger service to MSP-BIL-SEA. This was at the tail-end of a pilot/airline dispute. Northwest also served Billings with [[Boeing 727-200]], [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9-30]], [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9-50]], [[McDonnell Douglas MD-80]] and [[Airbus A319]] jetliners over the years.<ref>http://www.departedflights.com, Oct. 1, 1991 & June 1, 1999 editions, Official Airline Guide (OAG), Billings flight schedules; Sept. 9, 1987 Northwest Airlines system timtable</ref><ref>http://www.airliners.net, photo of Northwest Airlines A319 departing from Billings</ref>
In 1983, four airlines were operating mainline jet service into the airport: [[Continental Airlines]] with [[Douglas DC-9-10]] and [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9-30]] nonstop flights to Denver and Great Falls, the original [[Frontier Airlines (1950-1986)]] with [[Boeing 737-200]] nonstop flights to Denver, Great Falls and Helena, [[Northwest Airlines]] with [[Boeing 727-200]] nonstop flights to Great Falls, Helena, Minneapolis/St. Paul and Spokane with direct service to Chicago, Seattle and Portland, OR, and [[Western Airlines]] with [[Boeing 737-200]] nonstop flights to Salt Lake City with direct service to Los Angeles and San Francisco.<ref>http://www.departedflights.com, July 1, 1983 Official Airline Guide (OAG), Billings flight schedules</ref> By 1985, Northwest had once again added nonstop service to Chicago [[O'Hare International Airport]] flown with [[Boeing 727-200]] aircraft while [[United Airlines]] had begun flying [[Boeing 737-200]] nonstop service to Denver.<ref name="ReferenceA">http://www.departedflights.com, Feb. 15, 1985 Official Airline Guide (OAG), Billings flight schedules</ref> Also in 1985, the airport had commuter airline service operated by [[Big Sky Airlines]], [[Centennial Airlines]] and Pioneer Airlines with the latter air carrier operating as [[Continental Express]] on behalf of [[Continental Airlines]].<ref name="ReferenceA"/>
Another airline which operated jet service into Billings was [[Horizon Air]] which in 1999 was operating [[Fokker F28 Fellowship]] twin jets with nonstop flights to Seattle on behalf of [[Alaska Airlines]].<ref>http://www.departedflights.com, June 1, 1999 Official Airline Guide (OAG), Billings flight schedules</ref> By 2003, the airline was serving Billings with [[Canadair CRJ-700]] regional jets.<ref>http://www.airliners.net, photos of Horizon Air CRJ-700 aircraft at Billings</ref> Horizon Air continues to serve the airport at the present time on behalf of Alaska Airlines with the [[Bombardier Dash 8 Q400]] propjet which is the largest and fastest member of the [[de Havilland Canada DHC-8]] regional turboprop family of aircraft.<ref>https://www.alaskaair.com, Flight Schedules</ref> Additional airlines operating regional jets from the airport in the past included [[America West Express]] operated by [[Mesa Airlines]] with [[Canadair CRJ-200]] aircraft and [[Frontier JetExpress]] flown by [[Horizon Air]] with [[Canadair CRJ-700]] aircraft with both air carriers operating nonstop service to Denver.<ref>http://www.departedflights.com, April 7, 2002 America West Airlines system timetable</ref><ref>http://www.airliners.net, photos of America West Express and Frontier JetExpress aircraft at Billings</ref>
[[Big Sky Airlines]] was a commuter air carrier that was based in Billings from 1978 to 2008. Big Sky primarily operated small turboprop airliners including the [[Beechcraft 1900D]], [[British Aerospace]] [[BAe Jetstream 31]], [[Fairchild Swearingen Metroliner]] (Metro III and Metro 23 models) and [[Handley Page Jetstream]] as well as [[Cessna]] prop aircraft. The airline operated nonstop flights from the airport to [[Butte, MT]], [[Casper, WY]], [[Denver, CO]], [[Glasgow, MT]], [[Great Falls, MT]], [[Helena, MT]], [[Lewistown, MT]], [[Miles City, MT]], [[Sidney, MT]] and [[Wolf Point, MT]] at various times during its existence.<ref>http://www.departedflights.com, 11/15/79, 2/15/85, 10/1/91, 6/1/99 Official Airline Guide (OAG) editions, Billings flight schedules</ref> In addition, Big Sky operated direct, no change of plane flights from the airport to [[Bismarck, ND]], [[Boise, ID]], [[Dickinson, ND]], [[Havre, MT]], [[Jamestown, ND]], [[Kalispell, MT]], [[Minneapolis]]/[[St. Paul, MN]], [[Missoula, MT]], [[Moses Lake, WA]], [[Seattle, WA]], [[Spokane, WA]] and [[Williston, ND]] at various times during its existence as well.<ref>http://www.departedflights.com, Big Sky Airlines route maps</ref> Besides operating as an independent air carrier, Big Sky also operated [[Northwest Airlink]] service from Billings via a [[code sharing]] agreement with [[Northwest Airlines]] in 1989.<ref>http://www.departedflights.com, Dec. 15, 1989 Official Airline Guide (OAG), Billings flight schedules</ref>
==Airport governance== The Aviation and Transit Board governs BIL, with seven members, each appointed for four-year terms. It is required of the position of a board member to possess the qualifications fit for the Mayor's office. With the consent of the Council, the Mayor elects the board members. No board member may be reelected once his or her term expires. The purpose of the Aviation and Transit Board is not only to help govern the operations of the Airport, but also to act as a Citizen's Advisory Board to the City Council. They are to make sure that city policies are implemented and carried out. Shortcomings are to be reported and recommendations are to be made to the City Council.
==Facilities== Billings Logan International Airport has three runways. The primary runway is Runway 10L/28R with a length of 10,518 feet and width of 150 feet. ILS/DME on 28R is at 3,738 feet MSL is the lowest approach. The second runway is Runway 07/25 with a length of 5,501 feet and width of 75 feet; this runway serves as the crosswind runway. The final runway is Runway 10R/28L with a length of 3,801 feet and width of 75 feet. This runway serves as the primary runway for single engine and light piston aircraft. All three runways are asphalt.<ref>Federal Aviation Administration. (2013). Airport master record. Retrieved from {{cite web|url=http://www.gcr1.com/5010WEB/REPORTS/AFD02062014BIL.pdf |title=Archived copy |accessdate=April 28, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140429050026/http://www.gcr1.com/5010WEB/REPORTS/AFD02062014BIL.pdf |archivedate=April 29, 2014 |df=mdy }}</ref>
There are nine taxiways currently in use. Taxiway A runs parallel to Runway 10L/28R, serves as the last exit of Runway 10L and connects to the terminal area. Taxiway B runs through Runway 10L/28R as an access taxiway to the Northern Air Tanker Base. Three Taxiways, C, E F, serve as exit taxiways that vary in width to serve certain size aircraft. Taxiway D intersects Runway 10L/28R and serves as a northern exit point for Runway 25. Two taxiways (G and H) provide all exits for Runway 10R/28L and Runway 7. Finally, Taxiway J is the primary taxiway from the terminal area to the cargo ramps. Two hotspots exist on the airfield side of operations. Hotspot 1 is located at the intersection of Runway 10R/28L and Runway 7/25. Furthermore, Hotspot 2 is located at the intersection of Taxiway C and Runway 10L/28R.<ref>Billings Logan International Airport. (2007). Chapter 1: Inventory. Retrieved from http://flybillings.com/DocumentCenter/View/5987</ref>
In 2015, the airport had an average of 222 aircraft operations per day: 54% [[general aviation]], 33% [[air taxi]], 12% airline, and 1% military. 170 aircraft were then based at the airport: 56% single-engine, 33% multi-engine, 9% jet, and 3% [[helicopter]].<ref name="FAA" />
==Airlines and destinations== ===Passenger=== [[File:Airbus A320-200 at BIL.jpg|thumb|A taxiing [[United Airlines]] [[Airbus A320]].]] [[File:Airbus A319-100 at BIL.jpg|thumb|A [[Delta Airlines]] [[Airbus A319]] decelerating on the runway.]] [[File:Learjet 45 at BIL (2).jpg|thumb|A departing [[Learjet 45]].]] [[File:Billings Logan Intl Airport tower.jpg|thumb|Billings Logan Intl Airport tower]] {{Airport destination list <!-- --> | [[Alaska Airlines]] | [[Portland International Airport|Portland (OR)]], [[Seattle–Tacoma International Airport|Seattle/Tacoma]] <!-- --> | [[Allegiant Air]] | [[McCarran International Airport|Las Vegas]], [[Phoenix–Mesa Gateway Airport|Phoenix/Mesa]]<br />'''Seasonal:''' [[Los Angeles International Airport|Los Angeles]] <!-- --> | [[American Eagle (airline brand)|American Eagle]] | [[Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport|Dallas/Fort Worth]] <!-- --> | [[Cape Air]] | [[Glasgow Airport (U.S.)|Glasgow (MT)]], [[Dawson Community Airport|Glendive]], [[Havre City–County Airport|Havre]], [[Sidney–Richland Municipal Airport|Sidney (MT)]], [[L. M. Clayton Airport|Wolf Point]] <!-- --> | [[Delta Air Lines]] | [[Minneapolis–Saint Paul International Airport|Minneapolis/St. Paul]], [[Salt Lake City International Airport|Salt Lake City]]<br /> <!-- --> | [[Delta Connection]] | [[Minneapolis–Saint Paul International Airport|Minneapolis/St. Paul]], [[Salt Lake City International Airport|Salt Lake City]] <!-- --> | [[United Airlines]] | [[Denver International Airport|Denver]] <!-- --> | [[United Express]] | [[Denver International Airport|Denver]]<br />'''Seasonal:''' [[O'Hare International Airport|Chicago–O'Hare]] <!-- --> }}
===Cargo=== {{Airport destination list | [[FedEx Express]] | [[Denver International Airport|Denver]], [[Great Falls International Airport|Great Falls]], [[Memphis International Airport|Memphis]], [[Sioux Falls Regional Airport|Sioux Falls]] | [[UPS Airlines]] | [[Denver International Airport|Denver]], [[Louisville International Airport|Louisville]], [[Eppley Airfield|Omaha]], [[Ontario International Airport|Ontario]], [[Portland International Airport|Portland (OR)]] }}
==Statistics==
===Top destinations=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size: 95%" |+ '''Busiest routes from BIL (Feb 2017 - Jan 2018)'''<ref name="bts2">{{cite web|url=http://www.transtats.bts.gov/airports.asp?pn=1&Airport=BIL&Airport_Name=Billings,%20MT:%20Logan%20International&carrier=FACTS|publisher=transtats.bts.gov|title=RITA | BTS | Transtats |accessdate=Jan 9, 2018}}</ref> ! Rank ! Airport ! Passengers ! Carriers |- | 1 | [[Denver International Airport|Denver, Colorado]] | 115,000 | United |- | 2 | [[Salt Lake City International Airport|Salt Lake City, Utah]] | 81,000 | Delta |- | 3 | [[Minneapolis–Saint Paul International Airport|Minneapolis/St Paul, Minnesota]] | 79,000 | Delta |- | 4 | [[Seattle–Tacoma International Airport|Seattle–Tacoma, Washington]] | 46,000 | Alaska |- | 5 | [[Portland International Airport|Portland, Oregon]] | 21,000 | Alaska |- | 6 | [[Phoenix–Mesa Gateway Airport|Phoenix/Mesa, Arizona]] | 17,000 | Allegiant |- | 7 | [[McCarran International Airport|Las Vegas, Nevada]] | 15,000 | Allegiant |- | 8 | [[Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport|Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas]] | 14,000 | American |- | 9 | [[Sidney–Richland Municipal Airport|Sidney, Montana]] | 8,000 | Cape Air |- | 10 | [[L. M. Clayton Airport|Wolf Point, Montana]] | 4,000 | Cape Air |- |}
==Accidents and incidents== * On December 18, 1992, a [[Cessna 550]] arriving from Watertown, SD crashed on approach to runway 28R, killing all 8 occupants. Investigation found the cause to be wake turbulence from a Boeing 757 that arrived just prior to the incident, causing the aircraft to roll inverted.<ref name="ntsb">{{cite web|url=http://www.ntsb.gov/_layouts/ntsb.aviation/brief.aspx?ev_id=20001211X16242&key=1|publisher=ntsb.gov|title=SEA93GA041|accessdate=December 4, 2016}}</ref> * On May 23, 2008, [[Alpine Air]] Flight 5008, a [[Beechcraft 1900C]] registration N195GA acting as a contract mail flight, impacted the terrain about three miles northeast of Billings-Logan International Airport en route to Great Falls International Airport approximately three minutes after takeoff. The sole occupant, the pilot, was killed.<ref name="ntsb2">{{cite web|url=http://ntsb.gov/_layouts/ntsb.aviation/brief2.aspx?ev_id=20080530X00758&ntsbno=SEA08FA135&akey=1|publisher=ntsb.gov|title=SEA08FA135: Full Narrative|accessdate=December 4, 2016}}</ref> * On November 15, 2015, an [[El Al]] [[Boeing 777-200]] made an emergency landing at Billings Logan International Airport. The cockpit received an engine fire warning on the right hand engine. The plane was en route from [[Tel Aviv]] to [[Los Angeles]] carrying 297 passengers and 20 crew members. Inspection after landing indicated no fire was present.<ref name="usatoday">{{cite web|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/flights/todayinthesky/2015/11/16/yes-el-al-boeing-777-airport-billings-mont/75867774/|publisher=usatoday.com|title=Yes, that was an El Al Boeing 777 at the airport in Billings, Mont.|accessdate=December 4, 2016}}</ref>

revision.text:
{{Infobox musical artist | name = Brutus | image = | image_size = | landscape = <!-- yes, if wide image, otherwise leave blank --> | alt = | caption = | background = group_or_band | alias = Mandragora, Elektronik, Kyklop | origin = Czechoslovakia | genre = True bigbeat | years_active = 1967–present | label = | associated_acts = UK Subs, TV Smith, Suzi Quatro | website = <!-- {{URL|www.example.com}} --> | current_members = Pavel Fišar, Jozef Kupčík, Vladimír Hasal, Václav Trlica, Milan Křížanovský, František Matějovský, Alexander "Sáša" Pleska and Zbyněk Šlajchrt | past_members = 45 | module = | module2 = | module3 = }}
{{More citations needed|date=July 2014}} '''Brutus''' is a [[Czechs|Czech]] [[rock music|rock]] musical group with a long tradition. They call their style ''true bigbeat'' (the Czech word ''bigbeat'' is different from the [[Big beat|English use]] more or less connected with the music of the 1960s from [[rock and roll]] to rock music played for dancing)
Brutus was established in 1967 under the name ''Mandragora''. In 1973 their performances were banned by the [[communist]] censorship and they started playing under the name ''Elektronik''. The name was changed to ''Brutus'' in 1980 and there was a period (1982-1989) when the band had to play as ''Kyklop''. Since the [[Velvet Revolution]] in 1989 the band has again been called ''Brutus'' and has performed every Friday and Sunday of the year all around the [[Czech Republic]]. They played with British [[UK Subs]], [[TV Smith]], [[Suzi Quatro]], [[Dr. Feelgood (band)|Dr. Feelgood]] or Slovak [[Zóna A]], or [[No Name (Slovak band)|No Name]]. They also cooperate with [[The Vibrators]].
The group appeared in the movie ''Indian Summer'' (1995) by [[Saša Gedeon]].
== Members == There have been 45 members in the history of the band.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.brutus.cz/historie.htm |title=Historie skupiny BRUTUS |publisher=Brutus.cz |date= |accessdate=2014-07-04}}</ref> The founders of the band in 1966/7 were Vlastimil Beneš, Libor Laun, Michal Pleska, Miloslav Černý, Zdeněk Havelka, Vladimír Lankaš, Václav Matějka, Ivan Mikšovic, Jindřich Průcha, Zdeněk Steidl and Milan Tyburec.
Present members are Pavel Fišar, Jozef Kupčík, Vladimír Hasal, Václav Trlica, Milan Křížanovský, František Matějovský, Alexander "Sáša" Pleska and Zbyněk Šlajchrt.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.brutus.cz/fotogale01.htm |title=Fotogalerie BRUTUS - úvodní stránka |publisher=Brutus.cz |date=2008-07-05 |accessdate=2014-07-04}}</ref>
The band master is '''Vladimír Hasal''' (born 1955) and the front man is Alexander '''"Sáša" Pleska''' (born 1947) who plays the keyboard, sings and feeds the audience with his humour.
== Concerts and lyrics == The performance of Brutus takes four hours of music played almost with no break. They play every weekend on two places, big cities as well as [[whistle stop]]s.
The lyrics of the songs are mostly cheerful and the topics turn around music itself, dance, beer-drinking, rough sleepers and love.
The group also plays classic British and American rock and roll during their concerts.
== Discography == * ''Třikrát denně akt'' (1991; 2nd ed. 2002) * ''Mám horečku'' (1992; 2nd ed. 2010) * ''Somráci - Live'' (1993) * ''Celý večer rock and roll'' (1994) * ''Gorila'' (1995) * ''Best of Brutus'' (1997) * ''Deme na to'' (1998) * ''Alko alkohol, CD single'' (1999) * ''Dík za číslo'' (2005) * ''To samozřejmě můžeš'' (2008) * ''Alko alkohol- Pozdní sběr 1999'' (2009) * ''2011-05-28 Plasy, živák /live/'' (2011)
==References== {{Reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.brutus.cz/index.htm Group Page in Czech] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F0n7n17IZ1U A Sapmle live from YouTube]
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Brutus (Band)}} [[Category:Czechoslovak rock music groups]] [[Category:Czechoslovak Big Beat groups and musicians]]

revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2015}} :''DG Justice, Freedom and Security was split in 2010. For Home Affairs (security), see [[Directorate-General for Home Affairs (European Commission)]].'' {{Politics of the European Union}} The '''Directorate-General for Justice and Consumers''' ('''DG JUST''') is a [[Directorate-General]] of the [[European Commission]]. The role of the body is to ensure that the whole [[European Union]] (EU) is an [[area of freedom, security and justice]]. The specific tasks and responsibilities of the DG are laid down by the [[Treaty of Rome]] (see Part Two, Articles 17-22; Part Three, Title III, Articles 39-47), the [[Treaty of Amsterdam]] which came into force on 1 May 1999 and the conclusions of the [[European Council]] meeting in [[Tampere]] ([[Finland]]) in October 1999.
The relevant Commissioner is the ''European Commissioner for Justice, Consumers and Gender Equality'' (formerly [[European Commissioner for Justice, Fundamental Rights and Citizenship]]).
==Structure==
As of 2015, the DG Justice and Consumers is divided into 5 directorates,<ref>[http://ec.europa.eu/justice/about/files/organisation_chart_en.pdf Directorate-General Justice and Consumers Organisation chart], accessed 10 June 2015</ref> namely :
*Directorate A : Civil justice *Directorate B : Criminal justice *Directorate C : Fundamental rights and Union citizenship *Directorate D : Equality *Directorate E : Consumers
DG Justice and Consumers is responsible for relations with the following EU agencies : the [[EU Agency for Fundamental Rights]] (FRA), the [[European Institute for Gender Equality]] (EIGE) and the European Union Judicial Cooperation Unit ([[EUROJUST]]).
==History== DG JUSTICE was created in 2010 when the DG Justice, Freedom and Security was split into DG JUSTICE and the [[Directorate-General for Home Affairs]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Commission completes internal reshuffle|date=3 June 2010|work=[[EurActiv]]|url=http://www.euractiv.com/future-eu/commission-completes-internal-re-news-494849}}</ref>
==See also== *[[European Commissioner for Justice and Consumers]] *[[Directorate-General for Home Affairs]] *[[European Commissioner for Home Affairs]] *[[Justice and Home Affairs Council]] (Council of the European Union) **[[Directorate-General for Justice and Home Affairs]] *[[European Parliament Committee on Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs]] *[[Area of freedom, security and justice]] *[[Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union]] *[[Four Freedoms (European Union)|Four Freedoms]] *[[European Court of Justice]] *[[Court of First Instance]] *[[European Union Civil Service Tribunal]] *[[European Convention on Human Rights]] *[[European Court of Human Rights]] *[[Universal Declaration of Human Rights]] *[[International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights]] *[[International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights]] *[[Police and Judicial Co-operation in Criminal Matters]] *[[Eurojust]] *[[European Union Agency for Fundamental Rights]] (FRA) *[[European Institute for Gender Equality]] (EIGE) *[[Acquis_communautaire]]
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://ec.europa.eu/justice/index_en.htm DG Justice]
{{Eu-directorates-general}}
[[Category:Directorates-General in the European Commission|Justice]]
{{EU-stub}}

'''Directors Guild of Slovenia''' (DSR - Društvo slovenskih režiserjev) represents the interests of film and television directors in the [[Slovenia]]n [[motion picture]] industry. It was founded in 2005. This organization is a full member of ''[[La Fédération Européenne des Réalisateurs de l'Audiovisuel]]'' (FERA).
== Presidents ==
* 2005–2006 - [[Janez Lapajne]] * 2006–2010 - Martin Srebotnjak * 2010–present - Miha Hočevar
== External links == *[http://www.dsr.si Official DSR website]

revision.text:
'''Durihana Mission''' is a defector aid Christian organization based in [[South Korea]].<ref name= "oneill2009" />
==History== Chinese police arrested founder Pastor Chun Ki-won in 2002 on the Mongolian border, on the escape route he pioneered. His arrest and eight month imprisonment caused a stir in South Korea, exposing the plight of [[North Korean defectors]].
In 1995, as a missionary in the [[Yanbian Korean Autonomous Prefecture|Yanji region]], Chun met his first North Koreans in hiding. "These people had lost all their rights," he said. "The most important thing I could do was revive their humanity." Chun orchestrated the escapes of more than 700 North Koreans with only a handful of failures.<ref name="oneill2009">{{Citation | url = http://ngm.nationalgeographic.com/2009/02/north-korea/oneill-text/4 | title = Escaping North Korea | newspaper = National Geographic Magazine | page = 4}} focusing on Chun Ki-won.</ref><ref>{{Citation | date = May 15, 2003 | url = http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/chronicle/a/2003/02/15/MN143755.DTL | title = Christian underground smuggles North Koreans to safety in South | newspaper = SF gate}}.</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.durihana.net/about_durihana.aspx History of Durihana] * {{Citation | title = A missionary’s perspective | url = https://www.pbs.org/wnet/wideangle/episodes/crossing-heavens-border/video-a-missionarys-perspective/5065/ | newspaper = Crossing heaven’s border | publisher = PBS | place = [[United States of America|US]] | type = interview with Durihana founder Pastor Chun Ki Won}}.
[[Category:Korean migration]]

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Edward Snowden | image = Edward_Snowden_2013-10-9_(1)_(cropped).jpg | caption = Snowden in Moscow, October 9, 2013 }} '''Edward Snowden in popular culture''' is part of the [[reactions to global surveillance disclosures]] made by [[Edward Snowden]]. His impact as a public figure has been felt in cinema, advertising, video games, literature, music, statuary, and social media.
==Cinema== ===Shorts=== Snowden's passage through Hong Kong inspired a local production team to produce a low-budget five-minute film titled ''[[Verax (film)|Verax]]''. The film, depicting the time Snowden spent hiding in the [[The Mira Hong Kong|Mira Hotel]] while being unsuccessfully tracked by the [[CIA]] and [[Ministry of State Security (China)|China's Ministry of State Security]], was uploaded to YouTube in June 2013.<ref name="youtube-verax">{{cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OWVGDBeR42I |title=[v e r a x ] : Edward Snowden / ??? - Short Film |work=YouTube |publisher=JShotVideo |format=Video 5 Minuten |date=June 25, 2013 |accessdate=March 16, 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140328100750/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OWVGDBeR42I |archivedate=March 28, 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy}}</ref><ref name="investvine">{{cite web |url=http://investvine.com/ready-at-last-hong-kong-director-presents-snowden-movie/ |title=Ready at last: Hong Kong director presents Snowden movie |first=Arno |last=Maierbrugger |work=Investvine |date=July 4, 2013 |accessdate=March 16, 2014 |archivedate=March 16, 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6O7plUQ5T?url=http://investvine.com/ready-at-last-hong-kong-director-presents-snowden-movie/ |deadurl=yes |df=mdy}}</ref>
===Feature films=== A dramatic thriller, ''[[Classified: The Edward Snowden Story]]'', was released on September 19, 2014. This feature-length film, which was [[crowdfunded]] and offered as a free download, was directed by Jason Bourque and produced by [[Travis Doering]]. Actor [[Kevin Zegers]] played Edward Snowden, [[Michael Shanks]] played Glenn Greenwald and [[Carmen Aguirre]] played Laura Poitras.<ref name="cnbc-snowden-movie-crowedfunding">{{cite web |url=https://www.cnbc.com/id/101021408 |title=Filmmakers look to crowdfunding for Snowden movie |first=Arjun |last=Kharpal |work=Consumer News and Business Channel |date=September 10, 2013 |accessdate=March 16, 2014 |archivedate=March 16, 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6O7q2rBup?url=http://www.cnbc.com/id/101021408 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy}}</ref>
In 2014, film director [[Oliver Stone]] bought the rights to ''Time of the Octopus'', a forthcoming novel based on Snowden's life and written by his Russian lawyer, Anatoly Kucherena. Stone said he would use both Kucherena's book and [[Luke Harding|Luke Harding's]] nonfiction ''[[The Snowden Files]]'' for the screenplay of his movie, which began production later in 2014.<ref name="OliverStoneMovie">{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jun/11/oliver-stone-film-edward-snowden |title=Oliver Stone to make movie based on fictionalised life of Edward Snowden |last=Walker |first=Shaun |work=The Guardian |accessdate=June 11, 2014}}</ref> Stone's biopic ''[[Snowden (film)|Snowden]]'', which was released in September 2016, had Snowden portrayed by American actor [[Joseph Gordon-Levitt]], with a short appearance by Snowden himself in the last few minutes of the film. Shortly before release, Stone said that Snowden should be pardoned, calling him a "patriot above all" and suggesting that he should run the NSA himself.<ref name="wendy-mesley">{{cite video |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ueczcri7IJs |title=Oliver Stone on Edward Snowden and privacy rights |first=Wendy |last=Mesley |series=[[The National (TV program)|The National]] |publisher=[[CBC News]] |date=September 11, 2016}}</ref>
Snowden appears briefly as a character in the 2018 comedy-thriller [[The Spy Who Dumped Me]], in which he is played by British actor [[Tom Stourton]].
===Documentaries=== [[File:CITIZENFOUR (2014) trailer.webm|thumb|thumbtime=1:05|A trailer for ''[[Citizenfour]]'' (2014)]] On October 10, 2014, ''[[Citizenfour]]'', a documentary about Snowden, received its world premiere at the [[New York Film Festival]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.filmlinc.org/films/citizenfour/ |title=Citizenfour film |date=September 10, 2014 |accessdate=December 2, 2014 |publisher=filmlinc.com}}</ref> Earlier that year, director Laura Poitras told Associated Press she was editing the film in Berlin because she feared her source material would be seized by the government inside the U.S.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/snowden-documentary-premiere-ny-festival-25541267 |title=Snowden Documentary to Premiere at NY Festival |date=July 1, 2013 |accessdate=April 11, 2015 |agency=Associated Press |publisher=ABC News}}</ref> The two-hour film was shot in various countries, tracing Snowden's time in Hong Kong and Moscow.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.scmp.com/news/world/article/1614414/new-documentary-edward-snowden-covers-nsa-whistleblowers-hong-kong |title=Hong Kong in cinema spotlight in documentary on Edward Snowden |date=October 11, 2014 |work=South China Morning Post}}</ref> The film was released in the U.S. and Europe to wide acclaim from critics,<ref name="meta">{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/citizenfour/critic-reviews |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141103010101/http://www.metacritic.com/movie/citizenfour/critic-reviews |title=Citizenfour (2014): Reviews |work=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate=December 27, 2014 |dead-url=yes |archivedate=November 3, 2014 |df=}}</ref> and won the 2015 [[Academy Award for Best Documentary Feature]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.oscars.org/oscars/ceremonies/2015 |title=The 87th Academy Awards |work=oscars.org |accessdate=February 22, 2015}}</ref> Snowden declared in a February 2015 [[Reddit]] [[Reddit#IAmA and AMA|AMA]] ("Ask Me Anything") that he had no commercial interest in the film.<ref name=RedditAMA>{{cite web |url=https://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/2wwdep/we_are_edward_snowden_laura_poitras_and_glenn/ |title=We are Edward Snowden, Laura Poitras and Glenn Greenwald from the Oscar-winning documentary CITIZENFOUR |website=Reddit |accessdate=February 25, 2015}}</ref>
In October 2014, ''[[Killswitch (film)|Killswitch]]'', a film that features Snowden as well as [[Aaron Swartz]], [[Lawrence Lessig]] and [[Tim Wu]], received its world premiere at the [[Woodstock Film Festival]], where it won the award for Best Editing. It has since played alongside ''[[Citizenfour]]'' at the [[International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam]] and has continued an international film festival run. The film probes the efforts of big business to control the [[Internet]], the efforts of government to regulate it, the efforts of [[hacktivists]] to free up information worldwide and the consequences.<ref>{{cite news |last1=von Busack |first1=Richard |title=Breaking the Internet: Killswitch Screens at Cinequest |url=http://www.metroactive.com/features/cinequest-2015/Killswitch-Edward-Snowden.html |accessdate=February 25, 2015 |publisher=Metro Silicon Valley}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Battle for Internet Control Fuels O.C. -produced Movie |url=http://www.ocregister.com/articles/film-657978-internet-big.html/ |accessdate=April 16, 2015 |publisher=Orange County Register}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Killswitch |url=http://www.idfa.nl/industry/tags/project.aspx?id=da0e5628-3c33-4419-b909-4649fa05e0af |website=International Documentary Film Festival Amsterdam |accessdate=November 18, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150416020454/http://www.idfa.nl/industry/tags/project.aspx?id=DA0E5628-3C33-4419-B909-4649FA05E0AF |archivedate=April 16, 2015 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
A second Snowden documentary, titled ''Snowden's Great Escape'', coproduced by Germany's [[Norddeutscher Rundfunk]] and Denmark's [[DR TV]], was released in 2015. Filmed in Moscow, it incorporated two new interviews with Snowden and was awarded first prize in the documentaries category by Deutsche Fernsehakademie.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ndr.de/der_ndr/presse/mitteilungen/Preis-der-Deutschen-Fernsehakademie-fuer-NDR-Koproduktion-Jagd-auf-Snowden,pressemeldungndr16582.html |title=Preis der Deutschen Fernsehakademie für NDR Koproduktion "Jagd auf Snowden" |first= |last=NDR |website=www.ndr.de}}</ref>
In June 2018 as part of the anniversary of the revelations from Snowden, the documentary "Edward Snowden: Whistleblower or Spy", produced by Signpost Film Productions <ref>https://signpostfilmproductions.com/snowden/</ref> and GTV, <ref>http://www.gtv.ae/</ref> was released on Norwegian, Danish and Dutch Television and is continuing its further international release. The documentary presents interviews with participants and witnesses, some of whom have never before spoken on camera, and aims to incorporate the wide variety of views on the revelations. The documentary had a Festival release on the 4th of October 2018 at the Fraud Film Festival <ref>https://fraudefilmfestival.nl/en/programma/</ref> and was shown at the Cyber Security week also on the 4th of October 2018, both in The Netherlands <ref>https://www.cybersecurityweek.nl/programme/edward-snowden-whistleblower-or-spy</ref>.
==Advertising== [[File:Thank you Edward Snowden metrobus in DC.jpg|thumb|right|Thank you Edward Snowden bus in Washington, D.C., February 2014]] In the [[District of Columbia]], the [[Partnership for Civil Justice Fund]] (PCJF), a free speech advocacy group, [[crowdfunded]] an ad saying "Thank You Edward Snowden" that was featured on the sides of a D.C. city bus for four weeks in late 2013.<ref name=PoliticoBusDC>{{cite web |last=Kopan |first=Tal |title=Edward Snowden pic coming to D.C. buses |url=http://www.politico.com/story/2013/11/edward-snowden-buses-washington-dc-100137.html |work=Politico |accessdate=March 31, 2014}}</ref><ref name=DCbusControversial>{{cite news |last=Ly |first=Sherri |title=Metro bus ad thanks NSA leaker Edward Snowden |url=http://www.myfoxdc.com/story/24039053/metro-bus-ad-thanks-nsa-leaker-edward-snowden#axzz2xWC1uhRx |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131126070636/http://www.myfoxdc.com/story/24039053/metro-bus-ad-thanks-nsa-leaker-edward-snowden#axzz2xWC1uhRx |archivedate=November 26, 2013 |accessdate=March 31, 2014}}</ref> The PCJF said they received enough support from around the world to sponsor partial ads on five more buses in 2014.<ref name=DCistBus>{{cite web |last=Hughes |first=Sarah Anne |title=More Snowden Bus Ads Coming To D.C. |url=http://dcist.com/2014/01/more_snowden_bus_ads_coming_to_dc.php |work=DCist |accessdate=March 31, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140105060359/http://dcist.com/2014/01/more_snowden_bus_ads_coming_to_dc.php |archivedate=January 5, 2014 |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
==Video games== Snowden has been featured in video games<ref name="NBCvideogames">{{cite web |title=Yes, already: Two video games about Edward Snowden and stealthy data |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/video-games/yes-already-two-video-games-about-edward-snowden-stealthy-data-f6C10508739 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150725063126/http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/video-games/yes-already-two-video-games-about-edward-snowden-stealthy-data-f6C10508739 |archivedate=July 25, 2015 |work=NBC News |accessdate=March 31, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Sundby |first=Alex |title=Edward Snowden cast as hero in smartphone game |url=http://www.cnet.com/news/edward-snowden-cast-as-hero-in-smartphone-game/ |work=CNET |accessdate=March 31, 2014}}</ref> and has an action figure made in his image. Although not endorsed by Snowden, proceeds from the $99 doll are donated to [[Freedom of the Press Foundation]], where he serves on the board of directors.<ref name="NBCActionFigure">{{cite web |title=No Secret: Edward Snowden Gets Own Action Figure |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/no-secret-edward-snowden-gets-own-action-figure-n33221 |work=NBC News |accessdate=March 31, 2014}}</ref><ref name="CNETactionfigure">{{cite web |last=Kooser |first=Amanda |title=Edward Snowden action figure makes for toy whistle-blower |url=http://www.cnet.com/news/edward-snowden-action-figure-makes-for-toy-whistle-blower/ |work=CNET |accessdate=March 31, 2014}}</ref>
==Graphic novel== In May 2014, ''Beyond: Edward Snowden'', a graphic novel by [[Marvel Comics]] writer [[Valerie D'Orazio]], illustrated by Dan Lauer, appeared in both print and digital editions as part a new series from [[Bluewater Productions]], which the publisher said would reveal secret and suppressed stories.<ref name="GuardianComicBook">{{cite web |last=Flood |first=Alison |title=Edward Snowden gets his own graphic biography |url=https://www.theguardian.com/books/2014/may/20/edward-snowden-gets-graphic-biography-nsa-whistleblower |work=The Guardian |accessdate=May 20, 2014}}</ref><ref name="TimeComicBook">{{cite news |last=Feeney |first=Nolan |title=Edward Snowden, Comic-Book Hero |url=http://time.com/104921/edward-snowden-comic-book/ |work=TIME |accessdate=May 20, 2014 |date=May 19, 2014}}</ref>
==Music== On February 9, 2015, electronic pop producer [[Big Data (band)|Big Data]] released a song called "Snowed In" that featured vocals from [[Weezer]] frontman [[Rivers Cuomo]] from his debut album, ''[[2.0 (Big Data album)|2.0]]''. The song's lyrics, inspired by Snowden, are told from the perspective of the NSA, alternating between inner dialogue and statements made to the press.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Sharp |first1=Tyler |title=Rivers Cuomo guests on new Big Data track, "Snowed In" |url=http://www.altpress.com/news/entry/rivers_cuomo_guests_on_new_big_data_track_snowed_in |accessdate=March 26, 2015 |work=Alternative Press |date=February 9, 2015}}</ref>
In 2016, Snowden provided the vocals for a track titled "Exit" by digital composer [[Jean-Michel Jarre]]. The track interspersed a beat and a few notes with a recorded monologue by Snowden expressing views about digital privacy. Business news publication [[Quartz (publication)|Quartz]] described it as "not exactly music" and part of a "gimmicky new wave of political audio".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://qz.com/662914/the-sounds-of-snowden-welcome-to-the-year-of-politics-poorly-disguised-as-music/ |title=Edward Snowden hooked up with a French electronica artist to cut a track about cybersecurity |publisher=Quartz |accessdate=March 16, 2016}}</ref>
In 2016, the rock band [[Thrice]] released a song titled "Whistleblower" off of the album ''[[To Be Everywhere Is to Be Nowhere]]''. The song is written from the perspective of Snowden.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.baeblemusic.com/musicblog/4-25-2016/blood-on-the-sand-a-conversation-with-thrice.html |title='Blood on the Sand:' A Conversation With Thrice |last1=Montemarano |first1=Mike |publisher=Baeble Music |accessdate=April 25, 2016}}</ref>
==Statuary== On the April 5, 2015, episode of ''[[Last Week Tonight with John Oliver]]'', [[John Oliver (comedian)|John Oliver]] interviewed Snowden in [[Moscow]].<ref>{{cite video |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XEVlyP4_11M<!--?t=15m53s--> |time=15m53s| |title=Last Week Tonight with John Oliver: Government Surveillance (HBO) |website=[[YouTube]] |date=April 5, 2015 |accessdate=November 20, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://firstlook.org/theintercept/2015/04/06/john-oliver-interview-political-disengagement-american-public/ |title=Why john oliver can’t find americans who know Edward Snowden's name (it's not about Snowden) |last1=Greenwald |first1=Glenn |last2= |first2= |date=April 6, 2015 |website= |publisher=|access-date=April 6, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://money.cnn.com/2015/04/06/media/edward-snowden-john-oliver-interview/index.html?source=yahoo_quote |title=John Oliver lands Edward Snowden interview from Russia |last1=Stelter |first1=Brian |last2= |first2= |date=April 6, 2015 |website= |publisher=|access-date=April 6, 2015 |work=CNN}}</ref> The next day, activists briefly attached a [[Statue of Edward Snowden|bust of Snowden]] to the [[Prison Ship Martyrs' Monument]] in [[Fort Greene Park]] in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York City]], before being taken down by city officials.<ref name="GuardApr15">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/apr/06/edward-snowden-statue-bust-brooklyn-park-covered |first=Alan |last=Yuhas |title=Busted: Edward Snowden statue prompts cover-up at Brooklyn park |publisher=The Guardian |date=April 6, 2015 |accessdate=April 6, 2015}}</ref><ref name="statue">{{cite news |url=http://time.com/3772906/edward-snowden-statue-removed/ |title=New York City Takes Down Edward Snowden Statue Erected By Guerilla Artists |last1=Sifferlin |first1=Alexandra |last2= |first2= |date=April 6, 2015 |website= |publisher=|access-date=April 6, 2015 |work=Time}}</ref> Hours after the statue was removed, it was replaced by an ephemeral [[hologram]] image of Snowden.<ref name="MashableHologram">{{cite news |url=http://mashable.com/2015/04/07/edward-snowden-hologram-statue-brooklyn/ |work=[[Mashable]] |date=April 7, 2015 |accessdate=April 7, 2015 |title=Hologram replaces Edward Snowden statue in Brooklyn park |first1=Brian |last1=Ries}}</ref><ref name="Fishbein">{{cite web |url=http://gothamist.com/2015/04/07/edward_snowden_hologram.php#photo-1 |title=Illicit Edward Snowden Statue Replaced By Illicit Edward Snowden Hologram |first1=Rebecca |last1=Fishbein |first2=Kyle, Photographer |last2=Depew |newspaper=[[Gothamist]] |date=April 7, 2015 |accessdate=April 9, 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150408184248/http://gothamist.com/2015/04/07/edward_snowden_hologram.php#photo-1 |archivedate=April 8, 2015 |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref name="NPR">{{cite web |url=https://www.npr.org/blogs/thetwo-way/2015/04/07/398119206/an-edward-snowden-statue-was-replaced-by-another-snowden-image-last-night |title=An Edward Snowden Statue Was Replaced By A Hovering Snowden Image Last Night |first1=Sam |last1=Sanders |publisher=[[National Public Radio]] |date=April 7, 2015 |accessdate=April 8, 2015}}</ref> Authorities later returned the statue to its artists.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2015/may/07/artists-edward-snowden-statue-new-york-park-charges |title=Artists who displayed Edward Snowden statue in New York park escape charges |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=May 6, 2015 |agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref>
On [[May Day]] 2015, an [[art installation]] by Italian Davide Dormino titled ''[[Anything to Say?]]'' was placed in [[Berlin]]'s [[Alexanderplatz]]. It featured bronze sculptures of Snowden, [[Julian Assange]], and [[Chelsea Manning]] standing on chairs beside a fourth, empty chair meant as a platform for public speaking.<ref>[http://www.inquisitr.com/2060467/statues-of-whistleblowers-edward-snowden-julian-assange-bradley-manning-unveiled-in-berlin-germany/ Statues Of Whistleblowers Edward Snowden, Julian Assange, Bradley Manning Unveiled in Berlin, Germany] at Inquisitr.com; published May 2, 2015; retrieved May 5, 2015</ref><ref>[http://rt.com/news/255137-manning-assange-snowden-statue Holy Trinity of whistleblowers: Statues of Assange, Snowden and Manning go up in Berlin (VIDEO)] at [[RT (TV network)|RT]]; published May 2, 2015; updated May 3, 2015; retrieved May 5, 2015</ref>
==Social media== Snowden opened a [[Twitter]] account on September 29, 2015, amassing over a million followers in the first 24 hours; he followed only the NSA.<ref name=ArsTwitterNSA>{{cite web |last1=Mullin |first1=Joe |title=Ed Snowden joins Twitter, follows only the NSA |url=https://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2015/09/ed-snowden-joins-twitter-follows-only-the-nsa/ |website=Ars Technica |accessdate=October 5, 2015}}</ref> His first tweet received 121,728 retweets and 117,750 favorites.<ref name=SCMTwitter>{{cite web |last1=Haq |first1=Husna |title=Edward Snowden just joined Twitter. He's already creating a stir (+video) |url=http://www.csmonitor.com/Technology/2015/0930/Edward-Snowden-just-joined-Twitter.-He-s-already-creating-a-stir-video |website=Christian Science Monitor |accessdate=October 2, 2015}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Edward Snowden|popular culture]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of activists|Snowden, Edward]] [[Category:Topics in popular culture|Snowden, Edward]]

| embedded = }} '''Ekhagen Church''' ({{lang-sv|Ekhagskyrkan}}) is a [[church (building)|church building]] at [[Ekhagen]] in [[Jönköping]] in [[Sweden]], belonging to the [[Jönköping Kristina-Ljungarums Parish|Kristina-Ljungarum]] of the [[Church of Sweden]]. it was opened in 1996. However, a church has been around at Ekhagen since the early 1960s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.svenskakyrkanjonkoping.se/svenska-kyrkan/kyrkor/ekhagskyrkan/om-ekhagskyrkan/#.VKBRMl4A_c|title=Om Ekhagskyrkan|publisher=Church of Sweden|language=Swedish|accessdate=28 July 2012}}</ref>

revision.comment: Per [[MOS:LAYOUTEL]]
revision.text:
'''Framtiden i våre hender''' is an idealistic [[organization]] in [[Norway]] that advocates [[green consumption]] and [[resource justice]]. The [[Norwegian language|Norwegian]] name literally translates to '''The Future in Our Hands'''.
The organization is critical of the ever-increasing consumption in [[rich countries]] such as [[Norway]], and believes that consideration for [[nature]] and [[climate]] is more important than growth in [[Consumption (economics)|consumption]] and [[Economic growth|economy]]. The organization was inspired and founded by [[Erik Dammann]] in 1974,<ref name=":1">{{Cite journal|date=2016-07-15|title=Framtiden i våre hender|url=http://snl.no/Framtiden_i_v%C3%A5re_hender|journal=Store norske leksikon|language=no}}</ref> and is currently led by Anja Bakken Riise.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nrk.no/nyheter/ny-leder-i-framtiden-i-vare-hender-1.13446808|title=Ny leder i Framtiden i våre hender|last=NRK|work=NRK|access-date=2017-09-22|language=no}}</ref> It has approximately 27,000 members,<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.framtiden.no/om-oss.html|title=Om oss - Framtiden.no|last=hender|first=Framtiden i våre|work=Framtiden.no|access-date=2017-09-13|language=nb-NO}}</ref> and thereby is the largest environmental organization in Norway.<ref name=":1" />
== Core causes == The organization prioritizes three causes in particular:<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":0" />
1) [[Fair pay]] for those who make the [[Product (business)|products]] we use in everyday life - such as [[clothing]], [[food]] and [[mobile phones]] - especially in [[poor countries]].
2) Reduced [[meat]] consumption and production: for the sake of [[Natural environment|environment]], [[public health]], and [[animal welfare]].
3) [[Fossil fuel divestment]]: shifting [[investment]] from the [[coal]], [[oil and gas industry]] to [[renewable energy]].
== References == {{reflist|30em}}
== External links == *[https://www.framtiden.no/ Organization's homepage]
[[Category:Environmental organisations based in Norway]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1974]]
{{Norway-stub}}

revision.text:
[[File:Frederik Coning - detail of The Banquet of the Officers of the St George Militia Company in 1627 by Frans Hals.jpg|thumb|right|Frederik Coning, detail of Hals's banquet of 1627]] '''Frederik Coning''' (7 December 1594 – 7 June 1636), was a [[Dutch Golden Age]] member of the [[Haarlem schutterij]].
==Biography== He was born in Haarlem as the son of Hendrick Hendricksz and Neeltje Soeteman, and the brother of [[Cornelis Coning|Cornelis]] and [[Hendrick Coning|Hendrick]]. He married Jacquemijne de Wolff of Bruges, the widow of his brother-in-law Anthoni Regoot.<ref name=RKD>[http://explore.rkd.nl/nl/images/11132 Frederik Coning] in record for this painting in the [[RKD]]</ref> He became a lieutenant of the St. George militia in Haarlem from 1624-1627 and captain from 1630-1633. He was portrayed by [[Frans Hals]] in ''[[The Banquet of the Officers of the St George Militia Company in 1627]]''.
On 7 March 1635 he was buried in Haarlem.<ref name=RKD/>
==References== {{reflist}} *[http://nha.courant.nu/issue/JJVH/1961-01-01/edition/null/page/52 Frederik Coning] in ''De Haarlemse Schuttersstukken'', by Jhr. Mr. C.C. van Valkenburg, pp. 50–51, Haerlem : jaarboek 1961, ISSN 0927-0728, on the website of the North Holland Archives
{{authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Coning, Frederik}} [[Category:1594 births]] [[Category:1636 deaths]] [[Category:Frans Hals]] [[Category:People from Haarlem]]
{{Netherlands-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox mountain | name = Hübschhorn | photo = Col du simplon.jpg | photo_caption = View from the [[Simplon Pass]] (west side) | elevation_m = 3192 | elevation_ref = | prominence_m = 325 | prominence_ref = <ref>Retrieved from the [[Swisstopo]] topographic maps. The key col is the Homattupass (2,867 m).</ref> | parent_peak = [[Monte Leone]] | map = Switzerland | map_caption = Location in Switzerland | location = [[Valais]], [[Switzerland]] | range = [[Lepontine Alps]] | coordinates = {{coord|46|14|12.2|N|8|3|18.2|E|type:mountain_region:CH_scale:100000|format=dms|display=inline,title}} | range_coordinates = | first_ascent = | easiest_route = }} [[File:Hübschhorn vom Simplonpass aus gesehen.jpg|thumb|left|Hübschhorn seen from [[Simplon Pass]] (2017)]]
The '''Hübschhorn''' is a [[mountain]] of the [[Lepontine Alps]], overlooking the [[Simplon Pass]] in the canton of [[Valais]]. It belongs to the [[Monte Leone]] massif. Its altitude is 3190m/10'460ft.
==Access roads==
The car access is both from Italian and Swiss sides by following the road towards the [[Simplon pass]]. The closest cities are Domodossola on the Italian side and Brig on the Swiss side. If you need accommodation on the pass, you have Simplon Hospiz (Hospice du Simplon).
==Normal climbing route==
To climb Hübschhorn you start walking from the road towards a small lake which is directly below the mountain (Rotelsee). From there continue up by following a hardly visible steep path. You will need around three hours from the road to the summit.
You will be able to see the complete route to [[Wasenhorn]] and the glacier route to [[Breithorn (Simplon)]], and enjoy the views of the [[Weissmies]] group in the south-west direction.
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.hikr.org/dir/H%C3%BCbschhorn_2595/ Hübschhorn on Hikr] * [http://mountainsforeverybody.com/swiss-alps/hubschhorn-at-simplon-pass Hübschhorn - Route description] on Mountains for Everybody
{{Commonscat}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hubschhorn}} [[Category:Mountains of the Alps]] [[Category:Three-thousanders of Switzerland]] [[Category:Mountains of Switzerland]] [[Category:Mountains of Valais]] [[Category:Lepontine Alps]]
{{Switzerland-stub}}

'''Revolutionary Committee for Unity and Action''' (in [[French language|French]]: ''Comité Révolutionnaire d'Unité et d'Action'') was a militant group in [[Algeria]] fighting [[France|French]] colonial rule. CRUA regrouped former elements of [[Special Organisation (Algeria)|OS]] and radical from [[Movement for the Triumph of Democratic Liberties|MTLD]]. In total the founders of CRUA consisted of 33 persons.
CRUA would later evolve into the [[National Liberation Front (Algeria)|FLN]].
==Group of 22==
{{Div col|rules=yes|colwidth=22em}} *[[Mohamed Belouizdad]] *[[Mostefa Ben Boulaïd]] *[[Larbi Ben M'hidi|Mohamed Larbi Ben M'Hidi]] *[[Benmostefa Benaouda]] *[[Lakhdar Bentobal]] *[[Rabah Bitat]] *[[Zoubir Bouadjadj]] *[[Slimane Bouali]] *[[Ahmed Bouchaïb]] *[[Mohamed Boudiaf]] *[[Abdelhafid Boussouf]] *[[Mohamed Deriche|Liés Deriche]] *[[Mourad Didouche]] *[[Abdessalam Habachi]] *[[Abdelkader Lamoudi]] *[[Mohamed Mechati]] *[[Slimane Mellah]] *[[Mohamed Merzoughi]] *[[Badji Mokhtar]] *[[Abdelmalek Ramdane]] *[[Boudjemaa Souidani]] *[[Youcef Zighoud]] {{div col end}}
==References== *Tlemcani, Rachid, ''State and Revolution in Algeria''. Boulder: Westview Press, 1986. {{Africa-org-stub}} {{Algeria-hist-stub}} [[Category:Arab militant groups]] [[Category:French Algeria]] [[Category:National Liberation Front (Algeria)]] [[Category:Rebel groups in Algeria]]

revision.text:
[[Image:Jonines in Vepriai.jpg|right|thumb|Celebration of Saint Jonas' Festival in [[Vepriai]]]]
'''Saint Jonas' Festival''', also known as ''Rasos'' (''Dew Holiday''), ''Joninės'', ''Kupolė'', [[Midsummer Day]] or [[Nativity of Saint John the Baptist|Saint John's Day]]) is a [[midsummer]] [[folk festival]] celebrated on June 24 all around [[Lithuania]]. While midsummer day is celebrated throughout Europe, many Lithuanians have a particularly lively agenda on this day. The traditions include singing [[Daina (Lithuania)|songs]] and dancing until the sun sets, telling tales, searching to find the magic fern blossom at midnight, jumping over bonfires, greeting the rising midsummer sun and washing the face with a morning dew, young girls float flower wreaths on the water of river or lake. These are customs brought from [[Lithuanian mythology|pagan culture and beliefs]].
Once upon a time the [[Balts]], the ancestors of the Lithuanians, celebrated the feast of Rasos by offering sacrifices to the [[List of Lithuanian mythological figures|pagan gods]], and priestesses incited the altar fire. Only when Christianity came to Lithuania, this festival was identified with St. John name-day and since then was called Joninės (St. John's). Lithuanians with the names Jonas, Jonė, Janina receive many greetings from their family, relatives and friends.
==See also== * [[Kupolė]] * [[Ivan Kupala Day]] * [[Jāņi]] * [[Jaaniõhtu]] * [[Festa de São João do Porto]]
==References== * {{lt icon}} [http://www.romuva.lt/?kalba=engl&page=kalendorius&nr=6 Pagan rituals and meaning of Rasos]
[[Category:Festivals in Lithuania]] [[Category:June observances]] [[Category:John the Baptist]] [[Category:Saints days|Jonas]] [[Category:Annual events in Lithuania]] [[Category:Summer events in Lithuania]]
{{Reli-festival-stub}} {{Lithuania-stub}}

'''SANGONeT''' is a [[South Africa]]n organisation, whose acronym stands for The Southern African [[Non-governmental organization|NGO]] Network.
It is a civil society organisation with a focus on [[Information and Communications Technology|ICT]], which was founded in 1987, and has a history closely linked to the social and political changes experienced by South Africa during its transition to democracy.
In 2006, SANGONeT launched a new joint venture, called www.sangotech.org whose aim is to "meet and respond to the South African NGO sector's connectivity, hardware and e-business infrastructure * requirements."
==Central Case Management System== The Central Case Management System (CCMS) is an [[open source software]] that was developed by SANGONeT for the [[paralegal]] sector in [[South Africa]]. Designed to allow multiple organisations and paralegal offices to access, input and modify a central [[database]] of case records, the CCMS is a web-based [[thin-client]] application that eliminates the need to install and maintain [[software]] at each office.
==External links== * [http://www.ngopulse.org/ SANGONeT website]
[[Category:Organizations established in 1987]] [[Category:Non-profit organisations based in South Africa]] [[Category:Information technology organizations]]
{{Africa-org-stub}}

2015}} | Gini_rank = | HDI = 0.933 | HDI_year = 2017 | HDI_change = increase | HDI_ref = {{cite web |url=http://hdr.undp.org/en/composite/HDI |title=2018 Human Development Report |year=2017
